text: Psalm 140
Prayer for Help in the Face of Enemies
For the \add music\add* director. A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 140 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Rescue me, O Yahweh, from evil men.\f + \fr 140:1 \ft The several uses of the singular “man” in this psalm are probably collective \f*
Preserve me from violent men,
who plan evil \add things\add* in \add their\add* heart.
They stir up wars continually.
They sharpen their tongue as \add sharp as\add* a snake’s;
\add the\add* venom of a viper \add is\add* under their lips. \qs Selah\qs*
Protect me, O Yahweh, from \add the\add* hands of \add the\add* wicked.
Preserve me from violent men,
who have planned to ⸤make me stumble⸥.\f + \fr 140:4 \ft Literally “push my steps” \f*
\add The\add* proud have hidden a trap for me, and cords.
They have spread out a net along \add the\add* ⸤side⸥\f + \fr 140:5 \ft Literally “hand” \f* of \add the\add* path.
They have set snares for me. \qs Selah\qs*
I say to Yahweh, “You \add are\add* my God.”
Listen, O Yahweh, to the voice of my supplications.
O Yahweh, my Lord, the strength of my salvation,
you have covered my head in \add the\add* day of battle.
Do not grant, O Yahweh, \add the\add* desires of \add the\add* wicked.
Do not allow \add them\add* to attain their\f + \fr 140:8 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* plan, lest they be exalted. \qs Selah\qs*
\add With respect to the\add* head of \add those who\add* surround me,
may the harm of their lips cover them.
Let burning coals fall on them;
let them be dropped into the fire,
into bottomless pits \add from which\add* they cannot rise.
Do not let a ⸤slanderer⸥\f + \fr 140:11 \ft Literally “man of tongue” \f* be established in the land;
as for \add the\add* man of violence, let evil hunt him quickly.
I know\f + \fr 140:12 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) \f* that Yahweh will maintain \add the\add* cause of \add the\add* afflicted,
\add and\add* justice for \add the\add* needy.
Surely \add the\add* righteous will give thanks to your name;
\add the\add* upright will dwell in your presence.
